Description: Mould-made (likely) scarab in glazed composition; underside incised with bird, possibly Horus falcon with flail, and ankh sign to the right; blue glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Chautauqua Institution, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This piece is now lost. Brief description ('scarab, blue glaze') with sketch from Chautauqua distribution list of the Egypt Exploration Fund. The motif seems similar to one found on another scarab, BM 1886,0401.1638, but made out of blue paste, (published in Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, no. 59; Gorton 1996, 98, Type XXVIII A142). Gorton, A.F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis, Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.045) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Chautauqua Institution, Chautauqua (NY)
